intro: Ricinocarpos bowmanii var. albus, commonly known as the white-flowered rock heath, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form with small, leathery leaves. The plant produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
